articles.title: All Koreans Called upon to Remain True to Idea of "By Our Nation Itself"
articles.content:
Preparatory Committees Inaugurated in China 
    Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- The General Association of Koreans in China and the Youth Federation of Korean Nationals in China inaugurated
preparatory committees for celebrating the birthday of leader Kim Jong Il, which falls on February 16, with due ceremonies in Shenyang, China, on Jan. 3.
 Chairmen and members of the committees were elected at the ceremonies.    
 The preparatory committees decided to organize various colourful functions to celebrate the birthday of Kim Jong Il as the greatest auspicious holiday of the nation.

S. Korean Organizations Vow to Make 2005 Year of Reunification 
    Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- Members of the Democratic Workers' Party, the South Headquarters of the National Alliance for the Country's Reunification, the Confederation of Trade Unions and pro-reunification organizations and civic and public organizations of south Korea reportedly held a New Year meeting in Seoul on January 5 and decided to conduct a dynamic movement for independent reunification.
 The speakers at the meeting denounced the Uri Party for its perfidy to the people and its failure to scrap the "National Security Law" and called for an intensified fight for the repeal of the NSL and the pullout of the U.S. troops from south Korea to make this the year of independent reunification.    
 Meanwhile, Hwang Son, deputy spokesperson for the Reunification Solidarity of south Korea, in a commentary headlined "National cooperation, key to victory in 2005" on January 4 called upon all the people to actively seek national cooperation in an effort to make this year, in which fall the 60th anniversary of the liberation of the country and the fifth anniversary of the publication of the south-north joint declaration, the year of independent reunification, the year of a turn.

U.S. Congressman Leaves
    Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- Tom Lantos, member of the U.S. House of Representatives, and his party flew back Tuesday after wrapping up their
four-day visit to the DPRK.
 They were seen off by an official concerned at the airport.
